page.title: 17TRANSPORT
page.content: Most familys have at least one car and this is used to get to work and for shopping and recreation. There are some homes where mum cannot drive and so she relies on public transport if dad is not available. There is a good local train service into the city centre. This service is used to go shopping and to go to work. There is a reasonable bus service into the city centre as well. There are two types of bus. The red buses which come in to Birmgham from other near by towns, and the W.M.P.T.E buses which serve the local districts. Bicycles are a popular form of alternative transport. Forty five percent of the children under eleven have a bicycle and local schools in conjunction with the police, run cycle proficieny course in a bid to ensure their safety.
